cards.flavor_text: [i]He sustains himself on the blood of the wicked, gleaned from the blade of his sword.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Flying
cards.flavor_text: [i]The members of the Duskwatch depart while the realm is resting and return before it has awoken, silently charting the Aghesh from amongst the clouds.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
When Sootfoot Spelunker enters the battlefield, excavate. [i](Put the bottom card of your library into your graveyard. If it's a land card, put a colorless artifact token named Loot onto the battlefield. It has ‘Sacrifice this artifact: Add {1} to your mana pool.')[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]“You know what? I'm not feeling great today. I think I'll go home. We can fight the dwarves tomorrow.”[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]“Attacking the man who sold you the very sword you're attacking with? That's insolence, boy. Sheer insolence.”[/i]

cards.rules_text: Destroy all Auras attached to creatures and unattach all Equipments attached to creatures.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“I will be the arbiter of this match. The rules are as follows: No armor. No weaponry. No outside magic. Violation of the rules is punishable by divine execution. Are the two sides readied?”[/i]

cards.rules_text: When Lumbering Chains dies, draw a card.
cards.flavor_text: [i]The Chained now wander the realm, absorbing idle magic to be harvested by their captors.[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]The drakes glide high above the realm, playfully entertained by the commotion beneath them.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Whenever Putrid Carcass attacks, you lose 2 life.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“It's a slow, painful death. First, your muscles rot. Then your bones rot. Then your brain rots. Then you rise from the grave and you rot some more.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:

[i]“They say the Aghesh is free to explore for one and all. Well, Vetrayel may be dead, but I wouldn't get too comfortable exploring the jungle at night...”
— Riki Tawn, Storyteller[/i]

[i]“Catch that thief! He' robbed us of one of our swords!”
“Don't worry, I snatched his coin purse as he fled.”[/i]

cards.notes: *Each nation constructed a tower built to collapse on the Third Day the World Shook — each filled with their most important resource, so that they can be a) maintained and b) spread to the masses on the day that the world stills once more. The Aghesh has its own "tower", but it's not quite the same.

cards.flavor_text: [i]Tagdan reached for his blade as she descended, only to find it firmly stuck inside its hilt, as if the steel itself was cowering in fear.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Search your library for up to two Equipment cards with different names, reveal them, and put them onto the battlefield attached to target creature you control. Then shuffle your library.

cards.rules_text: Search target opponent's library for a creature card and exile it. Creatures you control become copies of that card until end of turn.

cards.flavor_text: [i]Re'eti blinked, refusing to believe his eyes. He had cast a simple incantation to cripple an enemy, yet now before him stood a god.[/i]

deviantart.com
**STORY: Shows up wherever there's no war. He avoids war because he's fairly fragile, but he loves essentially causing 'shenanigans' wherever he can provided it's not dangerous for him.
